text: The 1962 Winnipeg Blue Bombers finished in 1st place in the Western Conference with an 11–5 record. In a rematch of the previous season's Grey Cup Final, the Blue Bombers defeated the Hamilton Tiger-Cats to win the 50th Grey Cup. The win cemented the Bombers' status as a dynasty, having won four Grey Cups in five years. ==Preseason== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="5%"| Week ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="8%"| Date ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="20%"| Opponent ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="10%"| Score ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="10%"| Result ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="10%"| Record |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | A | July 23 | vs. Ottawa Rough Riders | 15–14 | Win | 1–0 |-align="center" bgcolor="#ffbbbb" | B | July 26 | at Montreal Alouettes | 53–0 | Loss | 1–1 |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | C | Aug 1 | at Toronto Argonauts | 17–14 | Win | 2–1 |} ==Regular season== ===Standings=== {| class="wikitable" |+ Western Football Conference !
